page.title: 09BILLERICAY NW Rail Transport
page.content: {Trains and the Railway Station { { }Billericay railway station is on the main{London}route from{Liverpool {Street to Southend.}The double track line runs through a deep cutting and the station has waiting rooms and a bookstall. The station is at its busiest in the mornings and in the evenings carrying many hundreds of commuters to and from London. An early train leaves at 04.37h but from 07.30h onwards 3 trains run each hour to London. The non_stop journey takes 24 minutes. The electric engines have from 3 to 8 carriages and are operated by the nationalised{British Rail. During the summer months a few excursion trains go to Southend.
